intro: Bartlettina guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan bartlettia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
